title: Unable to stretch last row or column using DrawBitmapLattice or DrawBitmapNinePatch
body:
## Description: 
There appears to not be a way to have the last row or column be stretchable using the SKCanvas.DrawBitmapLattice or SKCanvas.DrawBitmapNinePatch methods.  I have tried this using the UWP SkiaSharp.Views NuGet package (in a Xamarin.Forms custom renderer) as well as Android, iOS, and UWP Xamarin.Forms apps using SkiaSharp.Views.Forms Nuget package.  For simplicity, a Xamarin.Forms demo app has been provided.

## Demo App: 
https://github.com/baskren/SkiaSharpStretchLastRowColumnFail

## Observations:
1. Clone, build and run demo app for the platform of your choice
2. Click [Test1] button.   Notice the position of the sliders.  This represents the start (left) and end (right) of the stretchable region.  In [Test1], the left is 0 and the right is 25.  PLEASE NOTE THAT THE FIRST COLUMN OF THE BITMAP IS STRETCHED.
3. Click the [Test2] button.  Left is 1 and right is 25.  Note:  The first column is not stretched (as it should be) and the second column is stretched.
4. Click the [Test 3] button.  Left is 25 and right is 49.  Note how this appears to be the symmetrical equivalent of [Test 2] in that the second to last column is stretched but the last column is not.
5. Click the [Test 4] button.  Left is 25 and right is 50.  NOTE THAT THE ENTIRE BITMAP IS STRETCHED - IN OTHER WORDS, THERE ARE NO PATCHES!
7.  Click on the "use DrawBitmapNinePatch" switch and repeat steps 2-5.  Note that the results are the same.

## Expectations:
1. Tests 1 and 2 work as expected.
2. Test 3 should be the case where the last column is stretched (the symmetrical equivalent of Test 1).
3. Left slider 25 and right slider 48 should be the symmetrical equivalent of Test 2 (everything between 25 and the last column- but not the last column) is stretched.
